title: Mozilla developer edition çalışmıyor.
content:
Merhaba çok uzun zamandır mozilla developer edition kullanıyordum. Fakat son 1 haftadır hatalar alıyorum. Google da arama yaptığım zaman çıkan sonuçlara tıklayamıyorum, mouse tıklama görünümüne gelmiyor. Youtube sitesine giremiyorum hiç bir içerik yüklenmiyor. Haber sitelerinde reklamlar vs yüklenmiyor. Web whatsapp sitesine girdiğimde tarayıcı database hatası gibi bir hata alıyorum.

Güncelleme yapmaya çalıştım düzelmedi. Tekrar yükledim işe yaramadı. Tüm eklentileri devre dışı bıraktım çözüm olmadı.

Diğer tarayıcılarda bir sorun yok. Mozilla firefox tarayıcısında şuanda kullanabiliyorum ama şifrelerim, özelleştirmelerim ve eklentilerim developer edition tarayıcısında nasıl bir çözüm bulabilirim.

Bu soruyu bozuk olan tarayıcımdan açmaya çalıştım fakat çerezler depolanmıyor diye bir hata aldım. Çerez engelleyici yada reklam engelleyici kullanmıyorum.
creator: kcakir444

title: perdita di password
content:
Ho utilizzato il mio profilo firefox mozilla sul pc di mia figlia. Lei non ha un profilo mozilla, ma sul browser ha sempre salvato tutte le password. Dopo che mi sono sloggata dal mio profilo mozilla, mia figlia non riesce più a vedere le sue password. Come è possibile rimediare? Siamo sicuri che mia figlia non ha mai fatto un account su firefox, abbiamo controllato la posta e controllato la sincronizzazione con l'account di posta elettronica gmail. Le password perse sono password di portali di lavoro governativi. Molto grave.

Grazie
creator: anitafilisetti818

title: Font Courier New is broken in automatic email signatures on Outlook Live website (owa)
content:
For some reason my automatic email signatures in Outlook Live websites (outlook.live.com and owa's) become gibberish (see attached image). I have been having this problem for a while now (aka, not only after the last Firefox update), but it is intermittent.

I have already tried identifying whether the issue is in an extension or in Firefox itself, but without success. Whenever I restart Firefox in Troubleshoot mode, it solves the problem. But disabling all extensions and restarting Firefox does not. Restarting Firefox (not in Troubleshoot mode) sometimes solves the issue, as well as right after an update of the app; but not always. Starting Firefox after a computer restart usually brings the problem back. This problem also happens in my laptop (MacBookPro), so it is not restricted to this computer (macMini).

I would appreciate some help in identifying the culprit, so that I may contact the appropriate support team (if not Mozilla itself).
creator: tiago_p_lobo

title: Firefox Window Resizing when moving to another Screen, when there is differing DPI scales
content:
Hi,

I have a multi screen setup with my desktop, my main is 1440p(with 125% dpi scaling) and the others are 1080p(with 100% dpi scaling), I prefer it this way as text is displayed at a more consistent size between all screens.

However every time I move a Firefox window to another screen it will resize to fit within that screen, even when it would a have fitted fine as it was before the move.

This is of great inconvenience to me as it keeps on happening until the window size is unreasonably small...

I feel there is obviously a feature within Firefox that is causing this inconvenient behavior, as it does not happen to other software UIs, See this https://youtu.be/Hu61IGSrsKI

So Is there any way to prevent that behavior? , As I have not seen any options in settings that refer to it, nor have other resources online been informative.

Notes: I'm on windows 11 and I'm up to date, Yes I'm using some UI modes to make it look like Win10 but disabling them does not change this behavior Multi screen snap feature is disabled, Remember this is not happening to other UI windows on my system. Yes if I turning off the increased DPI scaling on my main screen it no longer happens, but if other UIs work fine why not Firefox, why do my preferences have to change to suit... :)

Any tips on this would be greatly appreciated
creator: djfrikition

title: Side tabs

creator: Casey2a

title: Uploading causes browser crash
content:
I'm using a Surface Pro 7+ with Windows 11 Home and Firefox 108.0.2.

Over the past few days, any attempt to upload files through the browser causes it to crash.

I can get as far as selecting the file I want to upload, and once the file explorer window closes, the browser appears to pause as if it's about to upload... then immediately crashes and pops up an error report ticket. This is consistent across multiple websites including Gmail, regardless of the style of upload form. A system reboot has no effect. This is the main device I use for school, and it's a pretty big problem if I can't upload my assignments on-the-go.

I also have a Dell Inspiron with Windows 11 Home and Firefox, but it doesn't encounter this problem.
creator: scootermilne
